definition: abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to appeal for justice/to demand redress for a grievance
popular nickname of Hai Rui 海瑞[Hai3 Rui4] (1514-1587), Ming politician, famous for honesty and integrity
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
to right wrongs/to redress an injustice
officials shield one another (idiom); a cover-up
facts of an injustice/circumstances surrounding a miscarriage of justice
lit. to kowtow like grinding garlic (idiom)/fig. to pound the ground with one's head
